construct.name: AkairoClient
construct.description:
The Akairo framework client.
Creates the handlers and sets them up.

params.name: clientOptions
params.description:
Options for Discord JS client.
If not specified, the previous options parameter is used instead.

props.name: ownerID
props.description: The ID of the owner(s).

props.name: util
props.description: Utility methods.

methods.name: isOwner
methods.description: Checks if a user is the owner of this bot.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for module loading and handling.

props.name: client
props.description: The Akairo client.

props.name: directory
props.description: The main directory to modules.

props.name: classToHandle
props.description: Class to handle.

props.name: extensions
props.description: File extensions to load.

props.name: automateCategories
props.description: Whether or not to automate category names.

props.name: loadFilter
props.description: Function that filters files when loading.

props.name: modules
props.description: Modules loaded, mapped by ID to AkairoModule.

props.name: categories
props.description: Categories, mapped by ID to Category.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Loads a module, can be a module class or a filepath.

params.name: thing
params.description: Module class or path to module.

params.name: isReload
params.description: Whether this is a reload or not.

methods.name: loadAll
methods.description: Reads all modules from a directory and loads them.

params.name: directory
params.description:
Directory to load from.
Defaults to the directory passed in the constructor.

params.name: filter
params.description:
Filter for files, where true means it should be loaded.
Defaults to the filter passed in the constructor.

methods.name: readdirRecursive
methods.description: Reads files recursively from a directory.

events.name: load
events.description: Emitted when a module is loaded.

params.name: isReload
params.description: Whether or not this was a reload.

events.name: remove
events.description: Emitted when a module is removed.

props.name: id
props.description: ID of the module.

props.name: categoryID
props.description: ID of the category this belongs to.

props.name: category
props.description: Category this belongs to.

props.name: filepath
props.description: The filepath.

props.name: client
props.description: The Akairo client.

props.name: handler
props.description: The handler.

construct.name: ClientUtil
construct.description: Client utilities to help with common tasks.

props.name: client
props.description: The Akairo client.

methods.name: resolveUser
methods.description: Resolves a user from a string, such as an ID, a name, or a mention.

params.name: users
params.description: Collection of users to find in.

params.name: caseSensitive
params.description: Makes finding by name case sensitive.

params.name: wholeWord
params.description: Makes finding by name match full word only.

methods.description: Resolves multiple users from a string, such as an ID, a name, or a mention.

params.name: wholeWord
params.description: Makes finding by name match full word only.

methods.description: Checks if a string could be referring to a user.

params.name: caseSensitive

methods.name: resolvePermissionNumber
methods.description: Resolves a permission number and returns an array of permission names.

methods.name: compareStreaming
methods.description:
Compares two member objects presences and checks if they stopped or started a stream or not.
Returns `0`, `1`, or `2` for no change, stopped, or started.

params.name: cache
params.description: Whether or not to add to cache.

props.name: command
props.description: The command this argument belongs to.

props.name: match
props.description: The method to match text.

props.name: type
props.description: The type to cast to or a function to use to cast.

props.name: flag
props.description: The string(s) to use for flag or option match.

props.name: multipleFlags
props.description: Whether to process multiple option flags instead of just the first.

props.name: index
props.description: The index to start from.

props.name: unordered
props.description: Whether or not the argument is unordered.

props.name: limit
props.description: The amount of phrases to match for rest, separate, content, or text match.

props.name: prompt
props.description: The prompt options.

props.name: default
props.description: The default value of the argument or a function supplying the default value.

props.name: otherwise
props.description: The content or function supplying the content sent when argument parsing fails.

props.name: client
props.description: The client.

props.name: handler
props.description: The command handler.

methods.name: process
methods.description: Processes the type casting and prompting of the argument for a phrase.

params.name: message
params.description: The message that called the command.

methods.name: cast
methods.description: Casts a phrase to this argument's type.

methods.name: collect
methods.description: Collects input from the user by prompting.

params.name: commandInput
params.description: Previous input from command if there was one.

params.name: parsedInput
params.description: Previous parsed input from command if there was one.

methods.name: cast
methods.description: Casts a phrase to the specified type.

methods.name: union
methods.description:
Creates a type from multiple types (union type).
The first type that resolves to a non-void value is used.

methods.name: tuple
methods.description:
Creates a type from multiple types (tuple type).
Only inputs where each type resolves with a non-void value are valid.

methods.name: validate
methods.description:
Creates a type with extra validation.
If the predicate is not true, the value is considered invalid.

methods.name: range
methods.description: Creates a type where the parsed value must be within a range.

params.name: inclusive
params.description: Whether or not to be inclusive on the upper bound.

methods.name: compose
methods.description:
Creates a type that takes the result of the first type and runs it with the second.
The first type should return a string since types expect a string as the input.

params.name: ignoreVoid
params.description: Whether or not to return null if the first type resolved with a void value.

methods.name: withInput
methods.description:
Creates a type that parses as normal but also carries the original input.
Result is in an object `{ input, value }` and wrapped in `Flag.fail` when failed.

methods.name: isFailure
methods.description: Checks if something is null, undefined, or a fail flag.

construct.name: TypeResolver
construct.description:
Type resolver for command arguments.
The types are documented under ArgumentType.

props.name: client
props.description: The Akairo client.

props.name: commandHandler
props.description: The command handler.

props.name: inhibitorHandler
props.description: The inhibitor handler.

props.name: listenerHandler
props.description: The listener handler.

props.name: types
props.description: Collection of types.

methods.name: type
methods.description: Gets the resolver function for a type.

params.name: types
params.description: Object with keys as the type name and values as the cast function.

props.name: aliases
props.description: Command names.

props.name: channel
props.description: Usable only in this channel type.

props.name: ownerOnly
props.description: Usable only by the client owner.

props.name: editable
props.description: Whether or not this command can be ran by an edit.

props.name: typing
props.description: Whether or not to type during command execution.

props.name: cooldown
props.description: Cooldown in milliseconds.

props.name: ratelimit
props.description: Uses allowed before cooldown.

props.name: defaultPrompt
props.description: Default prompt options.

props.name: description
props.description: Description of the command.

props.name: prefix
props.description: Command prefix overwrite.

props.name: clientPermissions
props.description: Permissions required to run command by the client.

props.name: userPermissions
props.description: Permissions required to run command by the user.

props.name: regex
props.description: The regex trigger for this command.

props.name: lock
props.description: The key supplier for the locker.

props.name: locker
props.description: Stores the current locks.

props.name: ignoreCooldown
props.description: ID of user(s) to ignore cooldown or a function to ignore.

props.name: ignorePermissions
props.description: ID of user(s) to ignore `userPermissions` checks or a function to ignore.

props.name: id
props.description: ID of the module.

props.name: categoryID
props.description: ID of the category this belongs to.

props.name: category
props.description: Category this belongs to.

props.name: filepath
props.description: The filepath.

props.name: client
props.description: The Akairo client.

props.name: handler
props.description: The handler.

methods.name: condition
methods.description: Checks if the command should be ran by using an arbitrary condition.

methods.name: before
methods.description: Runs before argument parsing and execution.

methods.name: parse
methods.description: Parses content using the command's arguments.

props.name: resolver
props.description: The type resolver.

props.name: aliases
props.description: Collecion of command aliases.

props.name: aliasReplacement
props.description: Regular expression to automatically make command aliases for.

props.name: prefixes
props.description: Collection of prefix overwrites to commands.

props.name: blockClient
props.description: Whether or not to block self.

props.name: blockBots
props.description: Whether or not to block bots.

props.name: fetchMembers
props.description: Whether or not members are fetched on each message author from a guild.

props.name: handleEdits
props.description: Whether or not edits are handled.

props.name: storeMessages
props.description: Whether or not to store messages in CommandUtil.

props.name: commandUtil
props.description: Whether or not `message.util` is assigned.

props.name: commandUtilLifetime
props.description: Milliseconds a message should exist for before its command util instance is marked for removal.

props.name: commandUtilSweepInterval
props.description: Time interval in milliseconds for sweeping command util instances.

props.name: commandUtils
props.description: Collection of CommandUtils.

props.name: cooldowns
props.description: Collection of cooldowns.

props.name: defaultCooldown
props.description: Default cooldown for commands.

props.name: ignoreCooldown
props.description: ID of user(s) to ignore cooldown or a function to ignore.

props.name: ignorePermissions
props.description: ID of user(s) to ignore `userPermissions` checks or a function to ignore.

props.name: prompts
props.description: Collection of sets of ongoing argument prompts.

props.name: defaultPrompt
props.description: Default prompt options.

props.name: prefix
props.description: The prefix(es) for command parsing.

props.name: allowMention
props.description: Whether or not mentions are allowed for prefixing.

props.name: inhibitorHandler
props.description: Inhibitor handler to use.

props.name: directory
props.description: Directory to commands.

props.name: modules
props.description: Commands loaded, mapped by ID to Command.

props.name: client
props.description: The Akairo client.

props.name: classToHandle
props.description: Class to handle.

props.name: extensions
props.description: File extensions to load.

props.name: automateCategories
props.description: Whether or not to automate category names.

props.name: loadFilter
props.description: Function that filters files when loading.

props.name: categories
props.description: Categories, mapped by ID to Category.

methods.name: runAllTypeInhibitors
methods.description: Runs inhibitors with the all type.

methods.name: runPreTypeInhibitors
methods.description: Runs inhibitors with the pre type.

methods.name: runPostTypeInhibitors
methods.description: Runs inhibitors with the post type.

methods.name: runCooldowns
methods.description: Runs cooldowns and checks if a user is under cooldown.

methods.name: parseCommand
methods.description: Parses the command and its argument list.

methods.name: parseCommandOverwrittenPrefixes
methods.description: Parses the command and its argument list using prefix overwrites.

methods.name: parseMultiplePrefixes
methods.description: Runs parseWithPrefix on multiple prefixes and returns the best parse.

params.name: pairs
params.description:
Pairs of prefix to associated commands.
That is, `[string, Set<string> | null][]`.

methods.name: parseWithPrefix
methods.description:
Tries to parse a message with the given prefix and associated commands.
Associated commands refer to when a prefix is used in prefix overrides.

methods.name: sweepCommandUtil
methods.description: Sweep command util instances from cache and returns amount sweeped.

params.name: lifetime
params.description:
Messages older than this will have their command util instance sweeped.
This is in milliseconds and defaults to the `commandUtilLifetime` option.

methods.name: addPrompt
methods.description: Adds an ongoing prompt in order to prevent command usage in the channel.

methods.name: hasPrompt
methods.description: Checks if there is an ongoing prompt.

methods.name: useInhibitorHandler
methods.description: Set the inhibitor handler to use.

methods.name: useListenerHandler
methods.description: Set the listener handler to use.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Loads a module, can be a module class or a filepath.

params.name: thing
params.description: Module class or path to module.

params.name: isReload
params.description: Whether this is a reload or not.

methods.name: loadAll
methods.description: Reads all modules from a directory and loads them.

params.name: directory
params.description:
Directory to load from.
Defaults to the directory passed in the constructor.

params.name: filter
params.description:
Filter for files, where true means it should be loaded.
Defaults to the filter passed in the constructor.

events.name: messageBlocked
events.description:
Emitted when a message is blocked by a pre-message inhibitor.
The built-in inhibitors are 'client' and 'bot'.

events.name: messageInvalid
events.description: Emitted when a message does not start with the prefix or match a command.

events.name: commandDisabled
events.description: Emitted when a command is found disabled.

events.name: commandBlocked
events.description:
Emitted when a command is blocked by a post-message inhibitor.
The built-in inhibitors are 'owner', 'guild', and 'dm'.

events.name: commandStarted
events.description: Emitted when a command starts execution.

params.name: args
params.description: The args passed to the command.

events.name: commandFinished
events.description: Emitted when a command finishes execution.

params.name: args
params.description: The args passed to the command.

events.name: commandCancelled
events.description: Emitted when a command is cancelled via prompt or argument cancel.

params.name: retryMessage
params.description:
Message to retry with.
This is passed when a prompt was broken out of with a message that looks like a command.

events.name: cooldown
events.description: Emitted when a command is found on cooldown.

params.name: remaining
params.description: Remaining time in milliseconds for cooldown.

events.name: inPrompt
events.description:
Emitted when a user is in a command argument prompt.
Used to prevent usage of commands during a prompt.

events.name: missingPermissions
events.description: Emitted when a permissions check is failed.

events.name: error
events.description: Emitted when a command or inhibitor errors.

events.name: load
events.description: Emitted when a command is loaded.

params.name: isReload
params.description: Whether or not this was a reload.

events.name: remove
events.description: Emitted when a command is removed.

props.name: handler
props.description: The command handler.

props.name: message
props.description: Message that triggered the command.

props.name: parsed
props.description: The parsed components.

props.name: shouldEdit
props.description: Whether or not the last response should be edited.

props.name: lastResponse
props.description: The last response sent.

props.name: messages
props.description: Messages stored from prompts and prompt replies.

methods.name: addMessage
methods.description: Adds client prompt or user reply to messages.

methods.name: setEditable
methods.description: Changes if the message should be edited.

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a response or edits an old response if available.

methods.name: sendNew
methods.description: Sends a response, overwriting the last response.

methods.name: reply
methods.description: Sends a response with a mention concantenated to it.

construct.name: Flag
construct.description: A special return value during commmand execution or argument parsing.

methods.name: cancel
methods.description: Creates a flag that cancels the command.

methods.name: retry
methods.description: Creates a flag that retries with another input.

methods.name: fail
methods.description: Creates a flag that acts as argument cast failure with extra data.

params.name: value
params.description: The extra data for the failure.

methods.name: continue
methods.description: Creates a flag that runs another command with the rest of the arguments.

params.name: ignore
params.description: Whether or not to ignore permission checks.

params.name: rest
params.description:
The rest of the arguments.
If this is not set, the argument handler will automatically use the rest of the content.

methods.name: is
methods.description: Checks if a value is a flag and of some type.

props.name: reason
props.description: Reason emitted when command is inhibited.

props.name: type
props.description: The type of the inhibitor for when it should run.

props.name: priority
props.description: The priority of the inhibitor.

props.name: id
props.description: ID of the module.

props.name: categoryID
props.description: ID of the category this belongs to.

props.name: category
props.description: Category this belongs to.

props.name: filepath
props.description: The filepath.

props.name: client
props.description: The Akairo client.

props.name: handler
props.description: The handler.

methods.name: exec
methods.description:
Checks if message should be blocked.
A return value of true will block the message.
If returning a Promise, a resolved value of true will block the message.

props.description: The Akairo client.

Tests inhibitors against the message.
Returns the reason if blocked.

typedefs.name: ProviderOptions
typedefs.description: Options to use for providers.

props.name: idColumn
props.description: Column for the unique key, defaults to 'id'.

props.name: dataColumn
props.description:
Column for JSON data.
If not provided, the provider will use all columns of the table.
If provided, only one column will be used, but it will be more flexible due to being parsed as JSON.
For Sequelize, note that the model has to specify the type of the column as JSON or JSONB.

typedefs.name: AkairoOptions
typedefs.description: Options for the client.

props.name: ownerID
props.description: Discord ID of the client owner(s).

typedefs.name: AkairoHandlerOptions
typedefs.description: Options for module loading and handling.

props.name: directory
props.description: Directory to modules.

props.name: classToHandle
props.description: Only classes that extends this class can be handled.

props.name: extensions
props.description:
File extensions to load.
By default this is .js, .json, and .ts files.

props.name: automateCategories
props.description: Whether or not to set each module's category to its parent directory name.

props.name: loadFilter
props.description:
Filter for files to be loaded.
Can be set individually for each handler by overriding the `loadAll` method.

typedefs.name: LoadPredicate
typedefs.description:
Function for filtering files when loading.
True means the file should be loaded.

typedefs.name: AkairoModuleOptions
typedefs.description: Options for module.

props.name: category
props.description: Category ID for organization purposes.

typedefs.name: ArgumentOptions
typedefs.description: Options for how an argument parses text.

props.name: id
props.description:
ID of the argument for use in the args object.
This does nothing inside an ArgumentGenerator.

props.name: match
props.description: Method to match text.

props.name: type
props.description: Type to cast to.

props.name: flag
props.description: The string(s) to use as the flag for flag or option match.

props.name: multipleFlags
props.description:
Whether or not to have flags process multiple inputs.
For option flags, this works like the separate match; the limit option will also work here.
For flags, this will count the number of occurrences.

props.name: index
props.description:
Index of phrase to start from.
Applicable to phrase, text, content, rest, or separate match only.
Ignored when used with the unordered option.

props.name: unordered
props.description:
Marks the argument as unordered.
Each phrase is evaluated in order until one matches (no input at all means no evaluation).
Passing in a number forces evaluation from that index onwards.
Passing in an array of numbers forces evaluation on those indices only.
If there is a match, that index is considered used and future unordered args will not check that index again.
If there is no match, then the prompting or default value is used.
Applicable to phrase match only.

props.name: limit
props.description:
Amount of phrases to match when matching more than one.
Applicable to text, content, rest, or separate match only.

props.name: default
props.description:
Default value if no input or did not cast correctly.
If using a flag match, setting the default value to a non-void value inverses the result.

props.name: otherwise
props.description:
Text sent if argument parsing fails.
This overrides the `default` option and all prompt options.

props.name: prompt
props.description: Prompt options for when user does not provide input.

typedefs.name: ArgumentPromptData
typedefs.description: Data passed to argument prompt functions.

props.name: retries
props.description: Amount of retries so far.

props.name: infinite
props.description: Whether the prompt is infinite or not.

props.name: message
props.description: The message that caused the prompt.

props.name: phrase
props.description: The input phrase that caused the prompt if there was one, otherwise an empty string.

params.name: failure
params.description: The value that failed if there was one, otherwise null.

typedefs.name: ArgumentPromptOptions
typedefs.description:
A prompt to run if the user did not input the argument correctly.
Can only be used if there is not a default value (unless optional is true).

props.name: retries
props.description: Amount of retries allowed.

props.name: time
props.description: Time to wait for input.

props.name: cancelWord
props.description: Word to use for cancelling the command.

props.name: stopWord
props.description: Word to use for ending infinite prompts.

props.name: optional
props.description: Prompts only when argument is provided but was not of the right type.

props.name: infinite
props.description:
Prompts forever until the stop word, cancel word, time limit, or retry limit.
Note that the retry count resets back to one on each valid entry.
The final evaluated argument will be an array of the inputs.

props.name: limit
props.description: Amount of inputs allowed for an infinite prompt before finishing.

props.name: breakout
props.description:
Whenever an input matches the format of a command, this option controls whether or not to cancel this command and run that command.
The command to be run may be the same command or some other command.

props.name: start
props.description: Text sent on start of prompt.

props.name: retry
props.description: Text sent on a retry (failure to cast type).

props.name: timeout
props.description: Text sent on collector time out.

props.name: ended
props.description: Text sent on amount of tries reaching the max.

props.name: cancel
props.description: Text sent on cancellation of command.

props.name: modifyStart
props.description: Function to modify start prompts.

props.name: modifyRetry
props.description: Function to modify retry prompts.

props.name: modifyTimeout
props.description: Function to modify timeout messages.

props.name: modifyEnded
props.description: Function to modify out of tries messages.

props.name: modifyCancel
props.description: Function to modify cancel messages.

typedefs.name: ArgumentMatch
typedefs.description:
The method to match arguments from text.
- `phrase` matches by the order of the phrases inputted.
It ignores phrases that matches a flag.
- `flag` matches phrases that are the same as its flag.
The evaluated argument is either true or false.
- `option` matches phrases that starts with the flag.
The phrase after the flag is the evaluated argument.
- `rest` matches the rest of the phrases.
It ignores phrases that matches a flag.
It preserves the original whitespace between phrases and the quotes around phrases.
- `separate` matches the rest of the phrases and processes each individually.
It ignores phrases that matches a flag.
- `text` matches the entire text, except for the command.
It ignores phrases that matches a flag.
It preserves the original whitespace between phrases and the quotes around phrases.
- `content` matches the entire text as it was inputted, except for the command.
It preserves the original whitespace between phrases and the quotes around phrases.
- `restContent` matches the rest of the text as it was inputted.
It preserves the original whitespace between phrases and the quotes around phrases.
- `none` matches nothing at all and an empty string will be used for type operations.

typedefs.name: ArgumentType
typedefs.description:
The type that the argument should be cast to.
- `string` does not cast to any type.
- `lowercase` makes the input lowercase.
- `uppercase` makes the input uppercase.
- `charCodes` transforms the input to an array of char codes.
- `number` casts to a number.
- `integer` casts to an integer.
- `bigint` casts to a big integer.
- `url` casts to an `URL` object.
- `date` casts to a `Date` object.
- `color` casts a hex code to an integer.
- `commandAlias` tries to resolve to a command from an alias.
- `command` matches the ID of a command.
- `inhibitor` matches the ID of an inhibitor.
- `listener` matches the ID of a listener.

Possible Discord-related types.
These types can be plural (add an 's' to the end) and a collection of matching objects will be used.
- `user` tries to resolve to a user.
- `member` tries to resolve to a member.
- `relevant` tries to resolve to a relevant user, works in both guilds and DMs.
- `channel` tries to resolve to a channel.
- `textChannel` tries to resolve to a text channel.
- `voiceChannel` tries to resolve to a voice channel.
- `role` tries to resolve to a role.
- `emoji` tries to resolve to a custom emoji.
- `guild` tries to resolve to a guild.

Other Discord-related types:
- `message` tries to fetch a message from an ID within the channel.
- `guildMessage` tries to fetch a message from an ID within the guild.
- `relevantMessage` is a combination of the above, works in both guilds and DMs.
- `invite` tries to fetch an invite object from a link.
- `userMention` matches a mention of a user.
- `memberMention` matches a mention of a guild member.
- `channelMention` matches a mention of a channel.
- `roleMention` matches a mention of a role.
- `emojiMention` matches a mention of an emoji.

An array of strings can be used to restrict input to only those strings, case insensitive.
The array can also contain an inner array of strings, for aliases.
If so, the first entry of the array will be used as the final argument.

A regular expression can also be used.
The evaluated argument will be an object containing the `match` and `matches` if global.

typedefs.name: ArgumentTypeCaster
typedefs.description:
A function for processing user input to use as an argument.
A void return value will use the default value for the argument or start a prompt.
Any other truthy return value will be used as the evaluated argument.
If returning a Promise, the resolved value will go through the above steps.

typedefs.name: FailureData
typedefs.description: Data passed to functions that run when things failed.

props.name: phrase
props.description: The input phrase that failed if there was one, otherwise an empty string.

params.name: failure
params.description: The value that failed if there was one, otherwise null.

typedefs.name: DefaultValueSupplier
typedefs.description: Function get the default value of the argument.

typedefs.name: ParsedValuePredicate
typedefs.description: A function for validating parsed arguments.

typedefs.name: OtherwiseContentSupplier
typedefs.description: A function returning the content if argument parsing fails.

typedefs.name: PromptContentModifier
typedefs.description: A function modifying a prompt text.

params.name: text
params.description: Text from the prompt to modify.

typedefs.name: PromptContentSupplier
typedefs.description: A function returning text for the prompt.

typedefs.name: CommandOptions
typedefs.description:
Options to use for command execution behavior.
Also includes properties from AkairoModuleOptions.

props.name: aliases
props.description: Command names.

props.name: args
props.description: Argument options or generator.

props.name: quoted
props.description: Whether or not to consider quotes.

props.name: separator
props.description: Custom separator for argument input.

props.name: flags
props.description: Flags to use when using an ArgumentGenerator.

props.name: optionFlags
props.description: Option flags to use when using an ArgumentGenerator.

props.name: channel
props.description: Restricts channel to either 'guild' or 'dm'.

props.name: ownerOnly
props.description: Whether or not to allow client owner(s) only.

props.name: typing
props.description: Whether or not to type in channel during execution.

props.name: editable
props.description: Whether or not message edits will run this command.

props.name: cooldown
props.description: The command cooldown in milliseconds.

props.name: ratelimit
props.description: Amount of command uses allowed until cooldown.

props.name: prefix
props.description: The prefix(es) to overwrite the global one for this command.

props.name: userPermissions
props.description: Permissions required by the user to run this command.

props.name: clientPermissions
props.description: Permissions required by the client to run this command.

props.name: regex
props.description:
A regex to match in messages that are not directly commands.
The args object will have `match` and `matches` properties.

props.name: condition
props.description: Whether or not to run on messages that are not directly commands.

props.name: before
props.description: Function to run before argument parsing and execution.

props.name: lock
props.description: The key type or key generator for the locker. If lock is a string, it's expected one of 'guild', 'channel', or 'user'.

props.name: ignoreCooldown
props.description: ID of user(s) to ignore cooldown or a function to ignore.

props.name: ignorePermissions
props.description: ID of user(s) to ignore `userPermissions` checks or a function to ignore.

props.name: defaultPrompt
props.description: The default prompt options.

props.name: description
props.description: Description of the command.

typedefs.name: BeforeAction
typedefs.description: A function to run before argument parsing and execution.

typedefs.name: KeySupplier
typedefs.description: A function used to supply the key for the locker.

typedefs.name: ExecutionPredicate
typedefs.description: A function used to check if the command should run arbitrarily.

typedefs.name: MissingPermissionSupplier
typedefs.description:
A function used to check if a message has permissions for the command.
A non-null return value signifies the reason for missing permissions.

typedefs.name: RegexSupplier
typedefs.description: A function used to return a regular expression.

typedefs.name: ArgumentGenerator
typedefs.description:
Generator for arguments.
When yielding argument options, that argument is ran and the result of the processing is given.
The last value when the generator is done is the resulting `args` for the command's `exec`.

typedefs.name: CommandHandlerOptions
typedefs.description: Also includes properties from AkairoHandlerOptions.

props.name: blockClient
props.description: Whether or not to block self.

props.name: blockBots
props.description: Whether or not to block bots.

props.name: prefix
props.description: Default command prefix(es).

props.name: allowMention
props.description: Whether or not to allow mentions to the client user as a prefix.

props.name: aliasReplacement
props.description:
Regular expression to automatically make command aliases.
For example, using `/-/g` would mean that aliases containing `-` would be valid with and without it.
So, the alias `command-name` is valid as both `command-name` and `commandname`.

props.name: handleEdits
props.description: Whether or not to handle edited messages using CommandUtil.

props.name: storeMessages
props.description: Whether or not to have CommandUtil store all prompts and their replies.

props.name: commandUtil
props.description: Whether or not to assign `message.util`.

props.name: commandUtilLifetime
props.description:
Milliseconds a message should exist for before its command util instance is marked for removal.
If 0, CommandUtil instances will never be removed and will cause memory to increase indefinitely.

props.name: commandUtilSweepInterval
props.description:
Time interval in milliseconds for sweeping command util instances.
If 0, CommandUtil instances will never be removed and will cause memory to increase indefinitely.

props.name: fetchMembers
props.description: Whether or not to fetch member on each message from a guild.

props.name: defaultCooldown
props.description: The default cooldown for commands.

props.name: ignoreCooldown
props.description:
ID of user(s) to ignore cooldown or a function to ignore.
Defaults to the client owner(s).

props.name: ignorePermissions
props.description: ID of user(s) to ignore `userPermissions` checks or a function to ignore.

props.name: defaultPrompt
props.description: The default prompt options.

typedefs.name: IgnoreCheckPredicate
typedefs.description: A function that returns whether this message should be ignored for a certain check.

typedefs.name: MentionPrefixPredicate
typedefs.description: A function that returns whether mentions can be used as a prefix.

typedefs.name: PrefixSupplier
typedefs.description: A function that returns the prefix(es) to use.

typedefs.name: MessageExtensions
typedefs.description: Extra properties applied to the Discord.js message object.

props.name: util
props.description:
Utilities for command responding.
Available on all messages after 'all' inhibitors and built-in inhibitors (bot, client).
Not all properties of the util are available, depending on the input.

typedefs.name: ParsedComponentData
typedefs.description: Various parsed components of the message.

props.name: command
props.description: The command used.

props.name: prefix
props.description: The prefix used.

props.name: alias
props.description: The alias used.

props.name: content
props.description: The content to the right of the alias.

props.name: afterPrefix
props.description: The content to the right of the prefix.

typedefs.name: InhibitorOptions
typedefs.description:
Options to use for inhibitor execution behavior.
Also includes properties from AkairoModuleOptions.

props.name: reason
props.description: Reason emitted when command or message is blocked.

props.name: type
props.description: Can be 'all' to run on all messages, 'pre' to run on messages not blocked by the built-in inhibitors, or 'post' to run on messages that are commands.

props.name: priority
props.description:
Priority for the inhibitor for when more than one inhibitors block a message.
The inhibitor with the highest priority is the one that is used for the block reason.

typedefs.name: ListenerOptions
typedefs.description:
Options to use for listener execution behavior.
Also includes properties from AkairoModuleOptions.

props.name: emitter
props.description: The event emitter, either a key from `ListenerHandler#emitters` or an EventEmitter.

props.name: event
props.description: Event name to listen to.

props.name: type
props.description: Type of listener, either 'on' or 'once'.
